solution_line_template: First find how many kids finish in under 6 minutes: {total_kids} kids * {percent_under_6}% = <<{total_kids}*{percent_under_6}*{percent_factor}={kids_under_6}>>{kids_under_6} kids
Then triple that number to find how many finish in less than 8 minutes: {kids_under_6} kids * {triple_factor} = <<{kids_under_6}*{triple_factor}={kids_under_8}>>{kids_under_8} kids

Then subtract those two numbers from the total number of kids to find the number of remaining kids: {total_kids} kids - {kids_under_6} kids - {kids_under_8} kids = <<{total_kids}-{kids_under_6}-{kids_under_8}={kids_remaining}>>{kids_remaining} kids

Then divide that number by {divisor_over_14} to find how many kids take more than 14 minutes: {kids_remaining} kids / {divisor_over_14} = <<{kids_remaining}/{divisor_over_14}={kids_over_14}>>{kids_over_14} kids
